page.title: 01Georgeham and Croyde
page.content: This area is mostly country-side and hilly with a few valleys.The country-side is taken up because of all the farms.They are mostly mixed farms.There are lots of bed & breakfast places and quite a few hotels.Some are only one minute walk to the beach others are about 5 to 10 minutes away.The area has a low population in the winter, with a quite high population for the area in the summer.There's about 14 shops in the area including a small museum and a few pottery shops but half are closed in the winter.There is one school in Georgeham.The area is built up by Georgeham, Croyde, Norh Buckland, Darracott and Lobb with mostly rough grazing in between the different places or normal farmland.Less than one thousand people live in the twelve square kilometres.
